TextAsset.value: (Took me a little while to get food for both of us.)
(Can’t plan a good heist on an empty stomach!)
(Or maybe you can. What do I know about heists!)
(Ah, there’s Max. I hope he wasn’t waiting long.)
(What am I thinking? He’s made out of feathers!)
You can do it. Just look. Just open your eyes and look down.
It’s not like it’s as high as f-f-flying.
Okay! You almost cracked open one eye a peep.
Let’s not overdo it all in one go. That’s enough for today.
(Oh, he’s away from the edge now. Good.)
(I’ll just, uh, I don’t want to embarrass him…)
I, uh, didn’t see you up here.
Or hear anything either, come to think of it.
Because there wasn’t anything to see or to hear. Yup.
On an innocuous change of topic, I brought us some food!
(And the Oscar for Best Actor goes to ${slot:playerName}!)
You didn’t have to do that.
Can’t plan a caper on an empty stomach!
You definitely made the right call!
It’s funny. In all my time at Namco High…
I never…well, y’know. Ate with someone.
That’s crazy. You usually eat in the cafeteria, right?
I usually don’t eat lunch at all.
Oh. That’s when your Military History Club meets, isn’t it?
But, yeah, that’s when it meets. I figure, since I’m not eating lunch, why bother going?
I can never hold on to my lunch money long enough to get to lunch!
I meant it more like a dramatic realization, not a declaration of his vicinity.
But that’s why? He revenges you?
He always catches me between classes.
I’m able to get away by tossing my lunch money at him and then RUNNING LIKE WOW.
Well, there’s not much we can do against Taira and his horde by ourselves.
Aren’t they were banished to a dimension of unliving horror by Principal Dig Dug though?
That’s just during detention. They’re free to tyrannize you all the rest of the time!
So let’s get those SECRET PLANE SUPER PROJECT designs and make sure you’re never pushed around again!
Let’s do that thing you said.
Max. Is there something else you’re not telling me?
I mean of course there isn’t, y’know, but like what?
(Hmmm. I think I know what it is.)
(Gonna have to play this one careful.)
But you have to get close to the edge to see it.
N-no. No, of course it isn’t.
But uh we don’t have time for sightseeing, ${slot:playerName}!
We’ve got a heist to orchestrate.
(Well, it’s pretty obvious if you’re paying attention at all.)
That’s not the important part though.
Don’t you think I know that!
I never heard of a bird afraid of flying.
I just happen to be one is all.
You don’t look like any penguin, emu, or ostrich I ever seen, Max.
Y-you don’t know. I could be!
Yeah, and I COULD be the King of Space.
(I guess I could be one day, depends on how our crazy system of succession works.)
Well, maybe I just don’t want to fly. What’s wrong with that?
You’re building an airplane SO HARD you’re in trouble for it!
And then all the Military History stuff on top of that.
It’s an attempt to make yourself feel big and important when really you’re just little and scared.
Taira would scare anybody. He’s undead!
But you don’t need to be scared of flying.
You can scrape your knee if you trip when you’re walking.
I bet you could break your neck if you tripped while flying!!!
(Man. I’m not getting through to this guy!)
Imparting wisdom to the troubled youths of today, of course.
You’ve got to be true to yourself.
It’s a matter of aerodynamics and evolution.
You mean…I don’t have to worry about hurting myself?

I don’t have to avoid confronting my fears by always thinking about military history and lingo and stuff so it looks like I’m totally not afraid to fly and maybe JUST MAYBE if everyone thinks I’m normal then I’ll think I’m normal too and I won’t have to think about how terrifying it is to fly all the time?
I think I can do it!
It’s just that you are LITERALLY A BIRD.
(We never did figure out how to get the designs back from the teachers’ vaults.)
(But if Blue Max can fly, then I guess it doesn’t matter!)
